A commercial insect repellent is being tested by the Ministry of Defence (MoD) to see if it can kill the novel coronavirus causing the current pandemic. 
Citriodiol, found in Mosi-guard, has previously proved effective at killing other coronaviruses, includi… [+6726 chars]

articles.author: Hanna Geissler, Daily Express Health Correspondent
articles.title: Coronavirus death rate: Third of victims who are admitted to hospital will die - Express.co.uk
articles.description: CORONAVIRUS is as deadly as Ebola for patients who are sick enough to be in hospital, an expert warned yesterday. A major study of almost 17,000 UK patients admitted in England, Scotland and Wales revealed that a third had died.

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/bbcnews
articles.title: Coronavirus: Tens of thousands more book tests in England - BBC South East Wales
articles.description: Staff and residents of care homes, over-65s and people who cannot work at home are now eligible for testing.
articles.content:
Image caption
 There are now 43 regional testing sites across the UK, according to the government
Tens of thousands of people have booked coronavirus tests after the government expanded who can apply in England.
